data.text:
@joyannehere I really hope not. 

I don't want to believe that there are people in HK inhumane enough to spread a deadly disease for a political cause.
@ChefMiew Probably the reason the virus spread so rapidly.  Packages going to mainland are being stopped as well.
@ChefMiew Actually HK population contain at least 30% brain damage creature low graded society trained by the UK
@alokjainhk @ChefMiew As they say “Put them in a jail and throw away the key!”

@ChefMiew Would need to see the methodology. Seems very hard to accurately measure COVID infections over a longer duration of time and representative for the whole population. Interested to see how they did measured. I’ll try and see if I can find it.
@SvdBHK I read a study based on random tests of households in a part of Australia after their omicron wave, and it said something like 1 in 6 tested were found to previously had Covid.

@ChefMiew Bit difficult to estimate, but cases per capita can depend on:
1. Testing (symptomatic only vs surveillance)
2. COVID definition (symptomatic disease only vs asymptomatic)
3. Self-reporting

I don’t think we can easily compare countries, unless modeling was done by experts https://t.co/9FWvwWVtmN

@SvdBHK I'm shocked by an estimate from HKU that 4.3m people will have been infected by the end of the the 5th wave in early May. That's 55% of the population.

I was thinking it would only be 1 in 6, like in Australia.

@ChefMiew Indeed unacceptable. The society has immune compromised patients and those who haven’t vaccinated because of reasons out of their control and we all have a duty to protect them. Even though it is a major outbreak, we need to be responsible and limit spread where we can.
